image.altText: A crowd of people holds signs at a rally

items.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie sends a blunt message to the Tasmanian government as the Greens Leader tells thousands opposed to the AFL stadium proposed for Hobart's waterfront she will work to defund it.

title.children: 'Stick it up your bum': Lambie rallies anti-stadium crowd with message to Tasmanian premier

image.altText: In this concept image, a stadium shines brightly in Hobart under an pink evening sky.

items.synopsis: Two Tasmanian Liberals have quit over the stadium deal, but, given the widespread joy that emanated following the granting of the AFL licence, handing it back after just 10 days would be as embarrassing as it is unlikely, writes Chris Rowbottom.

title.children: Is this the end of the stadium — and Tasmania's AFL dream?

image.altText: A young man on his balcony patting his dog and holding a glass of water.

items.synopsis: The long-term effects of multiple head knocks and concussion in professional sport has recently been in the spotlight. But, as Zac found out, just one hit can be life changing.

title.children: Zac wants what happened to him to be a warning to anyone who plays amateur sport

image.altText: A woman wearing a grey coat in a park looking serious.

items.synopsis: She was a teenage athlete with the world at her feet, but when Emily was sexually abused by a teacher at her high school, her world was turned on its head. Now she wants to help others in the same situation.

title.children: Emily was sexually abused by a school teacher and she wants you to hear her story

image.altText: A doctor wearing a white coat and a stethoscope writes on a clipboard.

items.synopsis: Tuesday's federal budget included a $5.7 billion boost for general practice, but that's not all the budget had in store for primary health care. Let's take a look at everything that's been announced and what it could mean for you and your health.

title.children: The way we see GPs is about to change. Here's how that's likely to impact you

image.altText: Emergency service and other vehicles at a beach.

items.synopsis: A man is suspected to have died following a shark attack near Elliston on the west coast of South Australia's Eyre Peninsula, where a search is underway.

title.children: Surfer feared dead after shark attack off SA's Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: A train halted in snow with snow-covered trees each side.

items.synopsis: After five decades working on Tasmanian railways, a driver takes readers on a thrilling ride where some days are literally train wrecks, and others operatic odysseys.

title.children: 'You see things no-one else could': Train driver's story a unique view of life on, and off, the rails

image.altText: A woman wields an axe from a car door.

items.synopsis: Police have now charged a road crash victim who wielded an axe and allegedly threatened emergency service workers when they tried to rescue her when her car rolled in Adelaide's south last night.

title.children: Crash victim brandishes axe as emergency staff try to rescue her from rolled car

image.altText: Don Farrell invited to Forbidden City in Beijing

items.synopsis: Trade Minister Don Farrell returns from a two-day trip to China without concessions from Beijing on a raft of trade bans against Australian exports, but says there is "positive momentum" in the countries' relationship.

title.children: Australian trade minister returns from China trip with agreements to 'step up' dialogue

image.altText: a young women walks with a huge bunch of flowers over her shoulder

items.synopsis: Tasmanian chrysanthemum grower Vaughn Kemsley is working around the clock to deliver flowers for mums.

title.children: Hectic time for chrysanthemum growers as harvesting for Mother's Day ramps up

image.altText: A man stands in university graduation gowns and cap.

items.synopsis: Court documents reveal a coach accused of raping former Melbourne Demons player Daniel Hayes served as the AFL's regional manager for northern NSW, helping to establish the Sydney Swans' academy in Coffs Harbour. Warning: This story includes text messages including graphic sexual content.

title.children: Coach accused of raping former AFL player was once employed by the league

image.altText: Louis Daniels walks next to a man wearing a suit.

items.synopsis: As former Tasmanian Anglican Priest Louis Victor Daniels is sentenced to six years in jail for the sexual abuse of two boys in the 1970s and 80s, one of them makes a plea for more abuse survivors to come forward.

title.children: Former Anglican priest Louis Daniels sentenced for 'heinous' sexual abuse of boys in Tasmania

image.altText: Prince William and Prince George stand either side of King Charles III as he sits on his throne at Buckingham Palace

items.synopsis: The royal family releases an official portrait of King Charles III alongside his direct heirs, Prince William and Prince George, as part of new photos released taken on the day of the King's coronation.

title.children: Three generations of royals pose together in new official portrait

image.altText: A wooden thermometer climbs to 40 degrees Celsius.

items.synopsis: Once trusted faces on the news, meteorologists now brave threats, insults and slander online from conspiracy theorists and climate change deniers who accuse them of faking or even fixing the weather.

title.children: Chemtrails, doctored temperatures and exaggerated global warming: Meteorology is new misinformation target

image.altText: An image combining photos of eight different people that were part of the disability royal commission

items.synopsis: The final disability royal commission hearing wrapped up this week. Many in the disability community hope all Australians now see how widespread their abuse and exploitation is.

title.children: Five of the biggest and most shocking takeaways from the disability royal commission

image.altText: a row of small tents uner the a bridge with a bicycle path in front of it.

items.synopsis: The Brisbane Lord Mayor has committed $1 million dollars to relocating people living in the city's parks to the empty $400 million COVID quarantine centre near the airport, but has not spoken to the federal government, who own the facility.

title.children: Three levels of government struggle to communicate as homelessness rises in Brisbane, mayor points to COVID facility

image.altText: A sheep with a wooly jumper on at Homebush farm, north-west of Stanthorpe.

items.synopsis: With winter approaching, the sheep grazier warning becomes a frequent and chilling feature of ABC weather forecasts and alerts from the Bureau of Meteorology. What does it mean for farmers? And sheep?

title.children: The sheep don't know it, but the Bureau of Meteorology regularly saves them from a chilly and unpleasant death

image.altText: Israel's Iron Dome missile defense system fires interceptors rockets launched from the Gaza Strip.

items.synopsis: Hopes of a truce between Israel and Palestinian militants after four days of fighting are dashed after a series of Israeli air strikes on Gaza kill a sixth senior member of Islamic Jihad and rockets are fired towards Jerusalem.

title.children: Palestinian militants fire more rockets, as Israeli air strikes hit Gaza despite ceasefire efforts

image.altText: Judge Kathy Seeley sits in a Montana courtroom in her black robes and speaks into a microphone

items.synopsis: A US judge says a climate change lawsuit from young people challenging Montana's pro-fossil fuel policies will proceed to trial despite efforts by the state to derail the case.

title.children: Youth-led climate lawsuit challenging Montana's pro-fossil fuel policies heads to trial

image.altText: A red, white and aqua coloured logo in  a J shape

items.synopsis: The former head of engineering made the complaint as part of a wrongful termination lawsuit.

title.children: Former ByteDance executive makes raft of accusations against tech giant

image.altText: A naked man stands with his arm around a naked woman on a beach.

items.synopsis: Queensland is the only mainland state where nudist beaches are illegal, but a recent police blitz has sparked a discussion about legislative change.

title.children: Noosa nudists seek amnesty after police crackdown

image.altText: A man in a grey jumper overlooks the water from a pontoon

items.synopsis: On what should've been a day of national pride, one man's bizarre outburst at a group of hobby fishermen has been described as "embarrassing for our country".

title.children: Suffering an unprovoked attack on Anzac Day, Job showed 'radical kindness' — and locals rallied around him

image.altText: Protesters were met with pepper spray

items.synopsis: Police have used pepper spray to contain violence between neo-Nazi and anti-fascist protesters outside Victorian Parliament.

title.children: Violent clashes between neo-Nazis and counter-protesters outside Victorian parliament

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in the House of Representatives

items.synopsis: Budget politics used to be pretty straightforward. It's all become a bit more complicated in a world where there are more than two parties and where the major opposition party is in some sort of crumbling withdrawal from political relevance, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The Coalition's crumbling withdrawal from political relevance is complicating budget politics

image.altText: A man in Islamic wear speaking to a room.

items.synopsis: A highly-respected Shariah scholar and London-based general practitioner will address a gathering of Muslim doctors who will discuss ethical issues raised by end of life care and organ donation.

title.children: Muslim doctors grapple with end-of-life ethical questions at first ever Islamic medicine conference in Sydney

image.altText: Linda Yaccarino Twitter Picture

items.synopsis: NBCUniversal's head of advertising Linda Yaccarino is set to become the new CEO of Twitter, Elon Musk confirms.

title.children: Who is Linda Yaccarino, the executive who will replace Elon Musk as Twitter CEO?

image.altText: A Ukrainian soldier fires an RPG in a forest area.

items.synopsis: Ukraine has been saying for months that it's planning a "spring offensive" in a bid to recapture territory from Russia and end the winter deadlock in the conflict. But with spring already sprung, what is Kyiv waiting for and what will they hope to achieve when the offensive finally begins?

title.children: What is Ukraine waiting for before beginning the much-anticipated 'spring offensive'?

image.altText: A black and white photo of young people dancing in a street in a town

items.synopsis: It is 50 years since the first Aquarius festival was held in Nimbin, but the counter-culture event has left a lasting legacy that is still being celebrated.

title.children: The festival that transformed a conservative dairy town into a haven for hippies and herbs

image.altText: An Australian female golfer hits a tee shot at an LPGA Tour event in New Jersey.

items.synopsis: Sarah Kemp enjoys a share of the halfway lead at the LPGA Tour event in New Jersey, with fellow Australian and defending champion Minjee Lee one shot back in a tie for third place.

title.children: Aussie Kemp on top of leaderboard at LPGA Tour's Founders Cup

image.altText: Dog sitting near a waterfall

items.synopsis: Scott Daniel rarely left the house before he was diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder. But he has since made up for lost time with faithful companion Reign by his side.

title.children: How Reign the spoodle's life on the road is helping anxious travellers spread their wings

image.altText: A red, green, blue and white satellite image of cyclone Mocha

items.synopsis: A tropical cyclone is set to hit the world's biggest refugee camp in Bangladesh with a storm surge of 2.5 metres.

title.children: 'Major impacts' expected as tropical cyclone heads for refugee camp in Bangladesh

image.altText: Close up of white man with curly blonde hair in a suit.

items.synopsis: The man who kept a chokehold around the neck of an agitated fellow passenger in the New York City subway, leading to the other rider's death, turns himself in to authorities.

title.children: Marine who fatally choked New York city subway rider Jordan Neely freed on bail

image.altText: Allison and Maxine stand in front of their graffiti painted Toyota Camry with fake eyelashes.

items.synopsis: More than 400 people, driving cars worth less than $1,500, will drive from Newcastle in New South Wales to Townsville in north Queensland to raise funds for the Cancer Council.

title.children: These mates are driving crappy cars almost 4,000km to raise money for cancer research

image.altText: Donald Craigie and Cheryl Fernando stand in a cemetary and look off into the distance.

items.synopsis: For decades, funeral insurer ACBF Youpla sold policies to First Nations Australians despite attention for regulators. Now, two years after it collapsed, the government is still wrestling with how to compensate the company's customers.

title.children: 'How much further can I be gutted?': Donald hopes the government will deliver on Youpla's broken promises

image.altText: The band Voyager put on exaggerated poses on a stage with a sign behind them saying 'Eurovision Australia Decides".

items.synopsis: After two electric semi-finals we’ve finally arrived at Eurovision’s pièce de résistance — the grand final.

title.children: When is the 2023 Eurovision grand final and how can I watch it in Australia?
